attributes.action: protect and enhance the social and cultural heritage of King's Cross
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The King's Cross Railway Lands are 67 acres of prime redevelopment site.   They include numerous listed buildings and two conservation areas, and were home in the 19th century to some of the most significant engineering triumphs in the world.   The area has been run down for decades and undoubtedly needs improvement.  However the London Borough of Camden in its urge to see something done, proposes to allow the demolition of blocks of solid Victorian housing to build offices, in an area desperate for social housing.   The King’s Cross Conservation Area Advisory Committee, the King’s Cross Railway Lands Group and many other residents’ groups believe the current plan fails to respect either the community or the heritage.   They say Think Again, and ask for your support.
